columns.text: In this exercise, we are asked to determine the amounts in each situation using exchange rates.

**Exchange rate** is the value of a country's currency when *express in another country's currency*.
\
We will look at Figure 21.1 of this book to answer the questions in the exercise.

## a.

We are asked to determine how many euros we can get if we have $100.
As a conclusion, if we have $100, we can get **€ 72.10**.

## b.

We are asked to determine how much is one euro worth.
We can see how much is one euro in Figure 21.1 of this book. Looking at the figure, the worth of one euro is **$ 1.3869**.

## c.

We are asked to determine the amount of dollars we can get if we have 5 million euros.
As a conclusion, if we have € 5,000,000, we can get **$ 6,934,500**.

## d.

We are asked to determine which is worth more, a New Zealand dollar or a Singapore dollar.

We can see the value of a New Zealand dollar and a Singapore dollar in Figure 21.1. Shown below are the values of the currency per U.S. dollars:

<center>

| Currency| Amount per U.S dollar | 
|--|:--:| 
|New Zealand dollar |1.1584 | 
|Singapore dollar |1.2528 | 
</center>

\
The value of New Zealand dollar per U.S. dollar is 1.1584 while the value of Singapore dollar per U.S. dollar is 1.2528. Hereon, we can see that the value of New Zealand dollar is worth more than the Singapore dollar when expressed per U.S dollar.
As a conclusion, **New Zealand dollar** is worth more than the Singapore dollar.

## e.

We are asked to determine which is worth more a Mexican peso or a Chilean peso.

We can see the value of a Mexican peso and a Chilean peso in Figure 21.1. Shown below are the values of the currency per U.S. dollars:

<center>

| Currency| Amount per U.S dollar | 
|--|:--:| 
|Mexican peso | 13.0434 | 
|Chilean peso | 564 | 
</center>

\
The value of Mexican peso per U.S. dollar is 13.0434 while the value of Chilean peso per U.S. dollar is 564. Hereon, we can see that the value of Mexican peso is worth more than the Chilean peso when expressed per U.S dollar.
As a conclusion, **Mexican peso** is worth more than the Chilean peso.

## f.

We are asked to determine how many Mexican pesos can you get for a euro and identify what is the rate called.
The value of the Mexican peso when expressed per U.S dollars is **M$ 13.0434**. On the other hand, the value of euros when express in U.S dollars is **$ 1.3869**.

The rate we have determined is called a **cross-rate**. It is an implicit exchange rate of two currencies quoted by another currency. Here, we determined the exchange rate of Mexican peso and euro quoted by U.S. dollars.
As a conclusion, we can get **M$ 18.0899** for a euro.

## g.


We are asked to determine which is the most valuable and least valuable currency.

We can determine the most valuable and least valuable currency when expressed in U.S dollars by looking at Figure 21.1 of this book. Hereon, the **most valuable currency** when express in U.S dollars is **Kuwait Dinar** expressed in $3.5606. On the other hand, the **least valuable currency** is **Vietnam dong** expressed in $0.00004742.
As a conclusion, the **most valuable currency** when express in U.S dollars is **Kuwait Dinar** while the **least valuable currency** is **Vietnam dong**.
To sum it all up, , we have determined the amounts in each situation using exchange rates shown in Figure 21.1 of this book.
